title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:14 <vmassol> has quit  
00:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <vmassol> has quit

06:00 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
06:11 <vmassol> has quit  
06:33 <coud10> has joined #xwiki  
06:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:46 <vmassol> has quit  
07:05 <jvelo> has quit  
07:09 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
07:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
08:56 <vmassol> we still have tests to fix before the release of tomorrow: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/  
08:56 <vmassol> ldap, selenium, ui, webstandards are failing  
08:57 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: good morning, this test is failing because of the hibernate warning: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/1910/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Blog\_\_page\_BlogScripts\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
08:57 <vmassol> (another reason to fix it ;))  
09:00 <vmassol> all ui tests are failing; should be easy to fix:  
09:00 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1760/consoleFull  
09:00 <vmassol> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Lexical error: org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.TokenMgrError: Lexical error at line 1, column 10.  Encountered: "&" (38), after : ""  
09:00 <vmassol> it seems one of our \*.vm file is not correct  
09:01 <vmassol> hmm I see:  
09:01 <vmassol> org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException: Failed to locate element from page source [<!--?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?-->  
09:01 <vmassol> <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">  
09:01 <vmassol> <html lang="en" xml:lang="en" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><head>  
09:01 <vmassol> why do we have a commented-out prolog?  
09:02 <vmassol> I also see: 2012-11-08 02:13:16,207 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register] ERROR o.x.v.i.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Exception in macro #loadConfig called at xwiki:XWiki.Registration[line 14, column 1]  
09:09 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: I'm debugging it right now.  I have confirmed that initHibernate is called several times via checkHibernate and that no exception was thrown by buildSessionFactory.  This makes me suspect that there are in fact several instances of the hibernate store.  
09:10 <vmassol> interersting...  
09:13 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: fyi I just for this when starting XE: https://gist.github.com/4037627  
09:50 <vmassol> https://raw.github.com/gist/4037627/0d21614a94ed84d5a091bcfdf0254856ffc6c2cc/gistfile1.txt  
09:50 <vmassol> not sure if it's related to your changes in the store or not  
09:50 <vmassol> but first time I see it  
09:51 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null  
09:51 <vmassol> at org.hibernate.impl.SessionFactoryObjectFactory.getNamedInstance(SessionFactoryObjectFactory.java:159) ~[hibernate-core-3.6.9.Final.jar:3.6.9.Final]  
09:51 <tmortagne> vmassol: nop it's xstream error when loading the jobs status  
09:51 <tmortagne> nothing to do with storage  
09:51 <tmortagne> ha this one  
09:51 <tmortagne> was talking about the bug one  
09:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: here's what I did: installed some extension with EM, removed them with EM, stoppped XE, removed in data/extensions the 3 dirs corresponding to the 3 extensions I had installed  
09:52 <vmassol> then restarted XE  
09:52 <tmortagne> but it seems to be triggered by the job loading  
09:53 <vmassol> this used to work before  
09:53 <tmortagne> need to understand who loading a job XML ended up in some hibernate class  
09:53 <tmortagne> how  
09:53 <vmassol> I've tried restarting XE twice and I get the same error every time  
09:54 <vmassol> yeah I can reproduce every time if you want a zip ;)  
09:55 <tmortagne> nop, no need  
09:55 <tmortagne> I thin kI found what changed  
09:56 <tmortagne> looks like thre store is logging something and put a SessionFactoryImpl as parameter of the log  
09:56 <tmortagne> and xstream seems to serialize but is unable to unserialize it proobably for a state issue  
09:57 <vmassol> ok was able to start after deleting:  
09:57 <vmassol> rm -Rf data/jobs/status/extension/action/org.pircbotx%3Apircbotx/  
09:57 <vmassol> rm -Rf data/jobs/status/extension/action/org.xwiki.platform%3Axwiki-platform-ircbot-ui/  
09:57 <tmortagne> now what I don't undedrstand is that it should not block the startup  
09:58 <tmortagne> will check what catch is there  
09:58 <vmassol> it doesn't block but you get all those stack traces  
09:58 <tmortagne> ha ok  
09:58 <tmortagne> you said you were not able to start  
09:58 <vmassol> wrong wording  
09:59 <vmassol> my use case is that I rebuilt some code locally and did a maven install  
09:59 <vmassol> and I wanted to reinstall the extesion  
09:59 <vmassol> but I need to remove extension cache  
09:59 <tmortagne> we need to make sure to not put object that complex in the log  
09:59 <vmassol> so that the new version is used  
10:00 <tmortagne> in this specifi case I don't understand why we put a SessionFactoryImpl as log parameter, I doubt its toString is that relevant, this is not a data  
10:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <tmortagne> will try to see if I can do a custom log serializer for xstream which only serialize Serializable log parameter  
10:04 <AndreasJonsson> Ah, obviously, there are 6 stores: XWikiHibernateStore, XWikiHibernateAttachmentStore, XWikiHibernateVersioningStore, HibernateAttachmentVersioningStore, XWikiHibernateRecycleBinStore, HibernateAttachmentRecycleBinStore, which means that the hibernateInitiated variable needs to be static. :)  My fault.  
10:04 <tmortagne> AndreasJonsson: the log serializer is too fragile anyway, it should not fail no matter what  
10:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <tmortagne> crap it's worst that I tough  
10:28 <tmortagne> SessionFactoryImpl is serailizable  
10:35 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <AndreasJonsson> What is this error? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2870/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/console  
10:53 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <tmortagne> AndreasJonsson: need to look at the build log  
10:54 <tmortagne> it means the test which is itself  a build failed  
10:55 <vmassol> the IT test failed  
10:55 <vmassol> to see why: "See /home/hudsonagent/hudson\_root/workspace/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/target/it/basic-import-export/build.log for details."  
10:57 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/ws/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/target/it/basic-import-export/build.log  
10:57 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException  
10:57 <vmassol> at com.xpn.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateBaseStore.beginTransaction(XWikiHibernateBaseStore.java:838)  
10:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: Thanks.  I have a good idea of what's wrong.  
11:13 <jvelo> has quit  
11:16 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <AndreasJonsson> I give up with double-checked locking in checkHibernate.  To guarantee that hibernate isn't initated twice we can either make checkHibernate synchronized, or add a getSessionFactorySynchronized method to HibernateSessionFactory in order to do a double checked locking.  For now, I just return it to the plain race condition it used to be. ;)  
11:52 <jvelo> has quit  
11:57 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:58 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <sburjan`> has quit  
12:54 <mflorea> has quit  
13:19 <polx> has quit  
13:25 <jvelo> has quit  
13:28 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <vmassol> so guys, what's our status on stuff that remains to be committed for 4.3M2 (ie tomorrow) and on tests?  
13:30 <vmassol> anyone still having code to commit?  
13:30 <vmassol> (except for blocking bug fixes)  
13:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think this one is for you: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/1739/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ldap/LDAPAuthTest/testLogAsXWikiUser/  
13:33 <vmassol> wait  
13:33 <vmassol> this one is fixed  
13:33 <vmassol> there remains this one:  
13:33 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/1746/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ldap/LDAPAuthTest/testLogAsLDAPUser/  
13:33 <vmassol> "Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: data exception: string data, right truncation  
13:33 <vmassol> "  
13:34 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: any idea? coudl it be caused by your changes?  
13:35 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/ started failing yesterday  
13:36 <vmassol> errrrrr, what's this too: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/  
13:36 <vmassol> going to stop it… that's strange  
13:37 <vmassol> I cannot stop it so maybe it's just not running and is a display bug  
13:38 <vmassol> I'd like to upgrade jenkins to the latest version, ok?  
13:38 <vmassol> (and restaft it at the same time)  
13:38 <vmassol> we're lagging behind by 9 versions  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <jvelo> has quit  
14:20 <vmassol> Enygma`: your solr module makes an old guava version being drawn in XE fyi  
14:20 <vmassol> (we've been discussing with tmortagne)  
14:21 <vmassol> r05 vs 12 drawn by reflections  
14:21 <vmassol> so there's a risk it's breaking reflections  
14:21 <vmassol> we should probably use 12 or the latest 13.0.1 in commons  
14:27 <crocket> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <crocket> When would xwiki support java 7 update 9?  
14:27 <crocket> java 8 is about to surface next summer.  
14:27 <vmassol> it doesn't already?  
14:27 <vmassol> xwiki should work on all version >= 6  
14:27 <crocket> XWiki is known to be slow with 7  
14:27 <vmassol> ah?  
14:28 <crocket> don't know.  
14:28 <vmassol> I don't know about it  
14:28 <crocket> Others in this channel said xwiki didn't support 7.  
14:28 <vmassol> if java7 is backward compat (as it should) then xwiki should work just ifne  
14:28 <vmassol> there's a difference between  
14:28 <vmassol> using java7 feature  
14:28 <vmassol> and working on java7  
14:29 <vmassol> if xwiki is slow on java7 then I'd say that java7 is buggy  
14:29 <vmassol> :)  
14:29 <vmassol> (on your os and for your JVM)  
14:29 <vmassol> I doubt oracle can risk having a not backward compat java7....  
14:31 <crocket> ???  
14:31 <crocket> Then why is xwiki.org so slow to respond?  
14:32 <vmassol> errr  
14:32 <vmassol> what's the relationship?  
14:32 <vmassol> and xwiki.org is not slow  
14:32 <crocket> Maybe it's because I didn't specify permgen size.  
14:32 <vmassol> what?  
14:32 <vmassol> you talk about xwiki.org  
14:32 <vmassol> and now about yourself  
14:32 <vmassol> you have me confused....  
14:33 <crocket> vmassol, sorry  
14:33 <crocket> vmassol, I should fix my brain.  
14:33 <crocket> I can't think linearly.  
14:33 <vmassol> :)  
14:33 <vmassol> there are tons of reasons why your instance can be slow  
14:38 <crocket> vmassol, How do I diagnose the cause?  
14:38 <vmassol> crocket: you could start by checking http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances  
14:39 <vmassol> then it depends what is "slow"  
14:39 <vmassol> whether it's all pages or only a specific page  
14:42 <Enygma`> vmassol: wondering if just excluding the transient dependency from the solr-api module would be enough  
14:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: the best solution is probably to declare the version we want in our top level pom  
14:43 <vmassol> as we do for other stuff  
14:43 <vmassol> it's always a bit risky but I don't know how to do ti better  
14:44 <vmassol> risky because if we upgrade a dep to a newer version that works only with a more recent version of a transitive dep and we forget to update its version of that dep then we have an issue… fortunatley we have our tests :)  
14:44 <vmassol> in this case the solr tests will tell us if it's not working anymore right? :)  
14:44 <Enygma`> yes, because if we update the library that depends on guava, we`ll be still using an old guava on the top project. We need to not forget about it in these cases.  
14:44 <Enygma`> :) right  
14:47 <crocket> vmassol, Every request is slow.  
14:47 <crocket> I probably need a more powerful CPU than ATOM D525.  
14:48 <coud10> has quit  
14:48 <Enygma`> vmassol: so what is the top level that we should use? It seems taht we have xwiki-commons pom and we also have xwiki-platform-core pom, both specifying dependency versions  
14:48 <vmassol> commons-pom  
14:49 <Enygma`> any particular reason for the xwiki-platform-core pom ?  
14:49 <vmassol> can't think of any  
14:49 <vmassol> unless we're 100% sure the dep is never used outside of platforme  
14:49 <vmassol> platform  
14:49 <vmassol> but we can't really guarantee this  
14:49 <Enygma`> I see... so theoretically the stuff in xwiki-platform-core should be moved to xwiki-commons  
14:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: any take on this?  
14:50 <tmortagne> not commons-pom  
14:50 <tmortagne> commons  
14:50 <vmassol> yes sorry, commons  
14:50 <coud10> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <tmortagne> the stuff in xwiki-platform-core is stuff we use only in platform  
14:51 <tmortagne> in this case we are using it in commons too  
14:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: sure but we cannot really guarantee this  
14:51 <tmortagne> since we use reflections in commons  
14:51 <tmortagne> why ?  
14:51 <tmortagne> we know what we are using  
14:51 <vmassol> yes sure  
14:51 <vmassol> but it's harder to be sure  
14:51 <vmassol> for ex if we had a module in enterprise  
14:51 <vmassol> we would need to remember to check it  
14:52 <vmassol> s/had/add  
14:52 <vmassol> now there are valid use cases for having different versions in different parts of xwiki  
14:52 <tmortagne> it's not about things we add by default in XE IMO, as long as we use something in severl different module we should piut its version in a commons place  
14:52 <vmassol> for ex  
14:53 <vmassol> we could have a given version of guava for xeclipse  
14:53 <vmassol> that's different from the version required by platform/xe  
14:53 <vmassol> in this case there's no reason to put one version over another in the top level pom  
14:53 <tmortagne> yes but xeclipse is different  
14:53 <vmassol> but this is true for all deps  
14:54 <vmassol> so in this case we're favorizing platform/xe  
14:54 <vmassol> over other potential projects  
14:54 <vmassol> that would also extend the top level pom  
14:54 <vmassol> I don't think our top level pom is meant to be only platform/xe  
14:54 <tmortagne> xeclipse can use whatever it want by redefining it  
14:55 <vmassol> ofc but as I said  
14:55 <tmortagne> same for any project  
14:55 <vmassol> so in this case we're favorizing platform/xe  
14:55 <vmassol> and there's no reason  
14:55 <vmassol> from the pov of the top level pom itself  
14:55 <vmassol> his role is not to be there jsut for platform/xe  
14:55 <vmassol> it's to be there for all top level projects  
14:56 <crocket> Is XWiki's WYSIWYG editor stable?  
14:56 <vmassol> crocket: yes  
14:56 <tmortagne> in this case it's not there only for platform, we need to put it in cmmons because we use that dep in both commons, rendering and platform  
14:56 <tmortagne> if this dep was only oin platform we could not put it in commons  
14:56 <crocket> vmassol, Does it break contents when switching between wiki and WYSIWYG modes?  
14:56 <vmassol> crocket: no  
14:56 <crocket> hmm.....  
14:57 <vmassol> that's why we wrote our own crocket, so that it's perfect ;)  
14:57 <vmassol> vs what you find in other wikis...  
14:57 <crocket> vmassol, your own what?  
14:57 <vmassol> own wysiwyg editor  
14:57 <vmassol> we rewrote is from scratch  
14:58 <vmassol> s/is/it  
15:00 <vmassol> Enygma`: so right now you could put in platform pom I guess to follow what thomas has started  
15:00 <vmassol> s/put/put it/  
15:01 <crocket> hmm  
15:01 <crocket> Maybe I should stick to XWiki after all.  
15:02 <crocket> But XWiki has complex UI.  
15:03 <vmassol> you're on latest version?  
15:03 <crocket> yes  
15:04 <crocket> The latest version presents us with complex UI.  
15:04 <vmassol> what part you find the most complex?  
15:05 <crocket> the main page has too many components.  
15:05 <crocket> I got confused.  
15:05 <vmassol> you can edit it  
15:06 <vmassol> it's your page  
15:06 <vmassol> you can put whatever you want in it  
15:06 <vmassol> if you're talking about skin then it's all pages, not just the main page  
15:06 <Enygma`> vmassol: AFAIU, tmortagne agreed that commons was the place to put it :)  
15:06 <vmassol> ah maybe because reflections is used in commons  
15:07 <vmassol> ?  
15:07 <Enygma`> yes, reflections is actually managed in commons (the dep)  
15:07 <tmortagne> as I said yes it's because reflections is used in commons  
15:07 <tmortagne> and in rendering  
15:07 <tmortagne> so it's very simple: the common place between all deps is commons in this case  
15:08 <Enygma`> ok, thank you both  
15:09 <vmassol> I hope jenkins is not stuck  
15:09 <vmassol> seems to take long to restart  
15:09 <vmassol> (it's not responding for me)  
15:09 <crocket> vmassol, Is http://www.terracotta.org built using xwiki?  
15:10 <vmassol> not that I know  
15:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: sometimes the jenkins restart after upgrade does not work  
15:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: yeah thye had problem in the past but I haven't see any problem in a while  
15:12 <vmassol> btw we probably need to update the agents too, it's probably a long time since we did that  
15:12 <vmassol> ah it's ok now  
15:13 <vmassol> :)  
15:13 <vmassol> just took long  
15:13 <vmassol> updating plugins  
15:25 <qwebirc45296> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <vmassol> Enygma`: version 12, not the latest one?  
15:31 <Enygma`> 12.0 was what we already used  
15:31 <vmassol> http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/wiki/Release13  
15:31 <Enygma`> but if you like, we can upgrade to 13.0.1  
15:31 <vmassol> yes but in general we try to use the latest  
15:31 <Enygma`> I did not put the latest because I did not know if there are any backwards compatibility issues  
15:31 <Enygma`> but ok  
15:32 <vmassol> yes we don't know  
15:48 <fmancinelli> quick question: is it possible to write files to the temporary directory from a groovy script?  
15:49 <cjd> fmancinelli: yeap  
15:50 <vmassol> fmancinelli: you need to get hold of the Environment component  
15:50 <cjd> just import java.io.File; and (the old way to do this is) Utils.getComponent(Environment.class), there's a new way but I don't know it off the top of my head  
15:50 <vmassol> no  
15:50 <vmassol> cjd: this is deprecated  
15:51 <vmassol> it's services.component.  
15:51 <cjd> I say old, you say deprecated, lets call the whole thing off (music)  
15:52 <cjd> services.component.getInstance(Environment.class) ?  
15:52 <vmassol> services.environment.getInstance(Environment.class)  
15:52 <vmassol> yup  
15:52 <fmancinelli> ok  
15:52 <fmancinelli> thanks  
15:52 <cjd> that is nicer since you don't have to import c.x.x.w.Utils  
15:53 <cjd> and ofc Utils holds a yucky global variable  
15:53 <vmassol> we could want to add an EnvironmentScriptService in the future too
